newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Daido,Sumikin form joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Daido,Sumikin form joint venture.

text.p: Concrete piling maker Daido Concrete (H.K.) Ltd said on Monday it and steel products trader Sumikin Bussan Corp had formed a joint venture to trade in construction materials and to undertake the contracting of construction projects.

The new company, S & D Design and Engineering (HK) Ltd, has HK$15 million in capital, of which 60 percent was invested by Sumikin and 40 percent by Daido, Daido Concrete (H.K.) Ltd said in a statement.
The joint venture would concentrate on public engineering works, supply of building materials and interior construction works in Hong Kong and Southeast Asia.
It estimated a turnover of about HK$800 million for the first financial year, and one of HK$1.1 billion after three years.
Sumikin would transfer its construction projects department and existing contracts to the new firm and Daido would transfer its trading department to the joint venture, the company said.
